title: 30+ Brutalist Fonts for Striking Designs
description: Discover the best Brutalist Fonts for striking designs in the Brutalism style. Unleash creativity with bold and raw aesthetics & make a powerful statement.
author: Jacob Cass
excerpt: Discover the best Brutalist Fonts for striking designs in the Brutalism style. Unleash creativity with bold and raw aesthetics & make a powerful statement.
text: Looking to infuse your designs with a raw and unconventional aesthetic? Look no further than our curated selection of Brutalist Fonts. Inspired by the architectural movement that shares its name, these fonts are designed to make a bold and striking impact. With their distinct characteristics and rugged charm, Brutalist fonts bring a unique personality to any design project. From websites to posters, logos to social media graphics, these fonts will captivate your audience and leave a lasting impression. Join us as we explore the best Brutalist fonts, handpicked to help you create designs that break the mold and make a statement. Get ready to embrace the power of Brutalism and elevate your designs to new heights of edginess! 10 Best Brutalist Fonts – Overview Wolker Nimbus Sans Monument Extended Molend Ella Planta Din 2014 Defrozo Mantra Cultrue Scroll on for the full list. Also see our features on the best 90s fonts, block fonts and geometric fonts. BEST BRUTALIST FONTS – UNLIMITED DOWNLOADS: 50 Million+ Fonts & Design Assets Download all the Brutalist Fonts you need and many other design elements, available for a monthly subscription by subscribing to Envato Elements. The subscription costs $16.50 per month and gives you unlimited access to a massive and growing library of over 50 million items that can be downloaded as often as you need (stock effect & element packs too)! 30+ Best Brutalist Fonts 1. Wolker When we talk about our first font, Wolker, we want to highlight its modern and essential characteristics. As a versatile font, it excels in large and medium sizes, bringing forth a stunning and commanding presence. With Wolker, we have the ability to layer two font styles, resulting in extraordinary headers that catch the eye. This font is the perfect choice for designs that embrace the theme of brutalism, adding a touch of raw power and edginess. Wolker’s characters are exceptionally well-suited for a wide range of applications. From editorial design to branding, advertising, T-shirt design, publicity, and digital media, Wolker delivers outstanding results. 2. Nimbus Sans We are excited to introduce the latest versions of the Nimbus font family from URW Type Foundry. Nimbus Sans Font is a comprehensive collection of fonts that offers a variety of styles and weights to suit different design needs. With its extensive range of options, this font family provides ample versatility for any project. Whether you’re working on print or digital media, Nimbus Sans Font has got you covered. 3. Monument Extended Our next font in line is Monument Extended, a truly powerful and versatile typeface that exudes quality. This extended font is designed to make a statement, whether you’re creating bold editorial designs, graphic-heavy prints, or even a simple yet impactful logo. Its distinctive and eye-catching appearance guarantees that your designs will stand out and leave a lasting impression of uniqueness. Monument Extended is a testament to the art of typography, meticulously crafted to ensure exceptional visual impact. Its extended letterforms provide ample space for creativity, allowing you to experiment and create visually striking compositions. The best part is that Pangram let you try this Neo Monument font for free, for non-commercial purposes. 4. Molend Looking for neubrutalism fonts? We are thrilled to introduce the Molend Font, designed by Ahmad Ramzi Fahruddin and published by Arterfak Project. This exceptional font family offers a unique and captivating style that is sure to elevate your designs. The Molend Brutalism Font Family consists of one exquisite style that showcases the talent and creativity of its designer. With its carefully crafted letterforms, Molend brings a touch of futuristic elegance and sophistication to any project. 5. Ella Ella, a stunning typeface that seamlessly blends classic calligraphy with contemporary digital design. The creation of Ella began as a morphological design study by Laura Mesegeur, who embarked on a journey to explore how traditional calligraphy models could be adapted and transformed into modern stencil typefaces. One defining characteristic of stencil type is the presence of negative space between each part of every letter, allowing for precise cutting into materials without the counters falling out. 6. Planta As designers who have had the pleasure of using the Planta Font Family, we can confidently say that it is a true masterpiece. Designed by Santi Rey and published by Monotype, Planta offers a delightful range of possibilities with its four unique styles and family package options. Planta is a font that effortlessly balances elegance and versatility. Its meticulously crafted letterforms exude a sense of refined sophistication, making it suitable for a wide array of design projects. 7. Din 2014 Embark on a typographic adventure with DIN 2014, a font that fuses the essence of a cherished classic with a contemporary twist. This captivating typeface pays homage to the renowned DIN typeface while breathing new life into its design. Since its release by Paratype, DIN 2014 has become a go-to choice for designers and typographers seeking a harmonious balance between tradition and innovation. You can also find a free DIN look-a-like on Google Fonts, called Barlow, which is our pick for one of the best neo brutalist fonts on Google Fonts. 8. Defrozo Introducing Defrozo font—an exquisite typographic masterpiece that has already captured the hearts of designers, illustrators, and creative enthusiasts around the globe. With its sleek, modern style and sans serif elegance, this font is a versatile gem that effortlessly enhances a wide array of design projects. 9. Mantra We are delighted to introduce Mantra, a remarkable font that is sure to captivate your imagination. This simple yet sophisticated condensed sans serif font, with its unique Inktraped and oblique speciality, is a true masterpiece. It brings a sense of joy and excitement to the world of typography and is perfectly suited for a diverse range of applications including headlines, billboards, magazines, websites, titles, posters, branding, and logos. 10. Cultrue Introducing Cultrue, a mesmerizing display typeface that will ignite your creative spark. With its bold characters and captivating presence, Cultrue is designed to make a statement with its all caps design. 11. Milston Imagine the excitement bubbling within as we introduce you to Milston Sans Serif font—a true game-changer for your upcoming projects. This remarkable typeface holds the key to unlocking a world of possibilities, allowing you to infuse your creative endeavors with sophistication. 12. Cormier We’re thrilled to introduce Cormier, an Art Deco themed typeface available in three captivating styles: Rough, Double, and Regular. This exquisite font brings to life the glamour and sophistication of the Art Deco era, offering a unique visual experience for your design projects. 13. GS. ArtDeco The extraordinary beauty of GS ArtDece, an Art Deco-inspired font that pays homage to the ornate ornaments, architectural marvels, and timeless style of the Gedung Sate Building in Bandung, West Java, Indonesia. Gedung Sate font is a true gem, perfect for enhancing the identity of your band, company, label, clothing brand, or any project that embraces vintage or classic aesthetics. Its exquisite design captures the essence of a bygone era, infusing your creations with a sense of sophistication and charm. 14. Wansura Introducing Wansura, an exquisite font that draws its inspiration from the captivating Art Nouveau era. This font embodies the essence of a time when signs, decorative visuals, architecture, art, and human aspects converged to create a truly remarkable period in history. Wansura is more than just a font; it’s a tribute to the artistic expressions of the past. With its graceful curves, intricate details, and flowing lines, Wansura captures the essence of the Art Nouveau movement. 15. Brutal Font We have the Brutal Font — what we love about this font is that it consists of letters brushed with sharp lines, giving the impression of cruelty. The Brutal Font is very suitable for themes like horror, sword action, and action games. We especially admire its ability to create captivating and intense visual experiences. This font lends itself perfectly to various design applications, including action game covers, logos, branding, product design, labels, and more. With its aggressive and impactful aesthetic, the Brutal Font adds a sense of power and intensity to any project it is used in. 16. Brutal Solid Next, we have the Brutal Solid font, which features a new and distinctive style. This font is perfect for a wide range of projects, including quotes, logos, blog headers, posters, branding, letters, invitations, stationery, and more. The Brutal Solid font offers a fresh and modern take on typography, with its bold and solid design. Its clean and sharp lines make it highly versatile, allowing it to seamlessly integrate into various design concepts. Whether you’re looking to create impactful quote graphics that grab attention, design a memorable and professional logo, or craft eye-catching blog headers, the Brutal Solid font provides the perfect balance of elegance and strength. 17. Black Brutal Introducing… Black Brutal, an exclusive typeface with a unique brush style. This font boasts a stunning character set, meticulously crafted with well-spaced letters and kerning. Its theme style encompasses horror, movies, games, vintage aesthetics, and classic brush styles. Black Brutal is the perfect choice for a wide range of projects, including branding, logos, business cards, flyers, brochures, and more. It seamlessly adapts to almost all industries, making it a versatile typeface that suits events, music videos, travel promotions, musicians, magicians, and many others. 18. Hurtmore We’re thrilled to introduce Hurtmore typeface, a font that can take your visuals to the next level. With its fun and playful handwritten design, featuring a realistic scribble style, Hurtmore injects a sense of loudness and boldness into your designs. One of the standout features of Hurtmore is its unique stylistic alternating character. This adds a touch of variation and authenticity to your text, creating a dynamic and visually engaging experience. 19. Assox We proudly present the Assox Typeface. This font draws inspiration from the design styles of the 70s, embodying a funny, groovy, and classic vibe. It’s a font that doesn’t take itself too seriously but carries a distinct aesthetic and holds exceptional value. Moreover, the Assox font is incredibly easy to remember, becoming the iconic image of any design it graces. Assox is a valuable addition to your font collection, offering a truly one-of-a-kind experience. Its versatility allows it to seamlessly integrate into various media with design concepts that embrace a non-serious, groovy, classic, funny, and unique approach. 20. Freco What we love about Freco, the modern serif font duo with sharp and expressive corners, is its versatility and impact. We appreciate how Freco effortlessly enhances titles, web designs, and branding projects, giving them a sleek and contemporary look. Its sharp corners add a touch of uniqueness, while the expressive forms lend a sense of sophistication and professionalism. When it comes to titles, Freco commands attention with its precise geometry and clean lines. It provides a strong visual presence that captivates viewers and makes a lasting impression. Whether it’s for headlines, banners, or promotional materials, Freco delivers with style. 21. Revolve Revolve is an absolutely stunning typeface that draws inspiration from the world of fashion magazines. Its thick-thin strokes bring forth an elegance that is simply captivating. Revolve is not just a pretty face; it is highly versatile and serves a multitude of purposes. Whether it’s for branding, social media, advertising, mood boards, packaging, editorial design, headlines, titles, or beyond, Revolve is ready to shine. Its beauty and versatility make it a go-to choice for a wide range of design projects. 22. Aurora We invite you to step into a world where we have already embraced the remarkable Aurora serif typeface. Designed to express boldness, artistry, and grandeur, this font has become an integral part of our creative endeavors. We love the versatility of Aurora, as it effortlessly adapts to different contexts. Whether used in normal case or showcased in all caps, we are captivated by its ability to make a stunning visual impact. This font adds a touch of uniqueness and style to our designs, setting them apart from the rest. 23. Migaela Allow us to introduce Migaela, the typeface that has become an integral part of our design endeavors. With its vibrant and charismatic personality, Migaela has brought a new level of optimism, inspiration, and expressiveness to our projects. Since incorporating Migaela into our designs, we have witnessed a remarkable transformation. Its cheerful and positive presence has infused our creations with a charming allure that captivates viewers and leaves a lasting impression. The versatility of Migaela, with its three optional styles—Regular, Overlap, and Smooth (rounded)—has allowed us to experiment and find the perfect fit for each project. 24. Black Mango Font Introducing the Black Mango Family, a modern and sleek typeface that offers a diverse range of possibilities. This versatile family comprises 9 weights and boasts numerous alternates that can be effortlessly combined to achieve unique and captivating designs. Whether you’re working on branding projects, web design, logos, or more, the Black Mango Family is your perfect companion. Its clean and contemporary aesthetic adds a touch of sophistication to any project, while its flexibility allows for seamless integration into various design contexts. 25. Absolute We, as a creative team, proudly present Absolute, a modern font that combines memorable elegance with stylish flair. Our font seamlessly blends the timeless appeal of a classic serif with the forward-thinking aesthetics of a futuristic sans serif. Absolute is meticulously crafted to capture attention and leave a lasting impression. Its versatile nature makes it an excellent choice for fashion-related branding projects and editorial design. 26. Valky Introducing Valky, a remarkable Fancy Modern vintage serif typeface that exudes elegance and sophistication. With its beautiful ligatures, extensive collection of special alternative glyphs, ornamental elements, and multilingual support, Valky is a font that embraces versatility and empowers creativity. Valky’s charm lies in its ability to shine in both large and small sizes. Whether you’re working on editorial projects, logo design, clothing branding, product packaging, magazine headers, or simply adding a touch of style to text overlays on background images, Valky delivers exceptional results. 27. Appears We are excited to introduce you to Appears, a captivating display serif font that has become a staple in our design toolkit. With its neat and sleek letterforms, it perfectly complements modern and minimalistic design themes, adding a touch of elegance to our projects. What sets Appears apart is its ability to stand out from the crowd. The inclusion of stylish alternates and ligatures makes this font even more unique and allows our designs to truly shine. 28. Moric On our 14th list, we proudly present Moric, a modern fashion serif font that adds a touch of uniqueness to your text. Each letter has been meticulously crafted to ensure a captivating and stylish appearance. Moric includes a collection of beautiful alternate glyphs, offering even more creative possibilities. Accessing these alternates is easy: Mac users can utilize Font Book, while Windows users can make use of the Windows Character Map. Inside the zip file, we have provided a tutorial link to guide you through the process. 29. Evangelina Introducing Evangelina, a remarkable display font that pays homage to the captivating fashion typography of the 1970s to present day. With its elaborate curves and unique shapes, Evangelina stands out and effortlessly grabs attention, making it an ideal choice for headings, logos, and wedding invitations. 30. Pleasure We are delighted to introduce Pleasure font, a captivating addition to our collection that is sure to elevate your design projects. This font set includes beautifully designed uppercase letters, numerals, and a wide range of punctuation marks. Pleasure Fonts embody a unique blend of blackletter aesthetics and modern style. Its striking visual elements combine traditional elegance with contemporary flair, creating a font that stands out from the crowd. Designed with versatility in mind, Pleasure Fonts lend themselves perfectly to a variety of creative endeavors. Whether you’re working on eye-catching posters, engaging web designs, captivating branding projects, intricate illustrations, stylish badges, or even shirt designs, Pleasure Fonts will help you bring your vision to life. 31. Horizon Last, but not the least, we proudly introduce Horizon, a bold and impactful font specifically crafted for important titles or names. With its commanding presence and strong letterforms, Horizon captures attention and exudes a sense of significance. This font’s bold and weighty design ensures that your titles or names take center stage, demanding the viewer’s attention. Whether it’s for branding purposes, headline displays, or other critical elements, Horizon adds a touch of power and distinction to your designs. Our Favorite Fonts for Brutalist Designs Still undecided? Below we’ve hand-selected our favorite brutalist fonts from the list. Monument Extended Brutalist Font Aurora Brutalist Font DIN 2014 Brutalist Font Mantra Brutalist Font Horizon Brutalist Font Appears Brutalist Font Wansura Brutalist Font GS. ArtDeco Brutalist Font Milston Brutalist Font Cormier Brutalist Font Cultrue Brutalist Font Defrozo Brutalist Font Best Google Fonts Best Adobe Fonts Best Headline Fonts Best Organic Fonts Best Emo Fonts Best Brutalism Fonts Summary Our best Brutalist fonts collection offers a diverse range of typefaces that embody the essence of the brutalist design movement. These fonts are characterized by their bold and raw aesthetics, with sharp lines and strong geometric forms. Each font in this collection has its own unique personality and charm, allowing designers to find the perfect fit for their specific project. From the edgy and aggressive Brutal Font to the solid and versatile Brutal Solid font, these typefaces cater to a wide range of design themes and applications. The Black Brutal font stands out with its exclusive brush style, making it a standout choice for horror, movie, and vintage-themed projects. On the other hand, the Hurtmore typeface adds a fun and expressive touch with its realistic scribble style, creating a sense of boldness and loudness. The collection also includes fonts like Assox, Freco, Revolve, and Aurora, each bringing its own unique flair and design elements. Whether you’re looking for a retro-inspired typeface, a modern serif font duo, or a fashion-inspired display font, the Best Brutalist Fonts collection has something to offer. By incorporating these fonts into your designs, you can elevate your visuals and create powerful and impactful experiences. These fonts are well-suited for various applications, including branding, web design, editorial projects, packaging, and more. Frequently Asked Questions What is neo brutalism design? Neo-Brutalism design is a modern take on Brutalist architecture, emphasizing raw, minimal aesthetics. It incorporates geometric shapes, bold colors, and a functional approach, creating a striking, unconventional style often used in UI design, web layouts, and contemporary branding. What is a brutalist design? Brutalist design comes from the French term béton brut, meaning raw concrete. It emerged in the late 1940s and early 1950s, emphasizing exposed materials, minimal ornamentation, and a bold, utilitarian aesthetic focused on structure and functionality over decoration. What is the brutalist font? A brutalist font embraces the raw, unpolished aesthetic of brutalist design. These fonts often feature bold, heavy letterforms, sharp edges, and unconventional structures, reflecting the stark, functional nature of brutalism with non-traditional layouts and striking visual impact. What does Brutalism symbolize? Brutalism symbolizes resilience, functionality, and honesty in design. It represents creation from raw, unadorned materials, emphasizing structure over ornamentation. Rooted in post-war reconstruction, it stands as a bold statement of strength, simplicity, and purpose in both architecture and visual design. What is brutalist web design? Brutalist web design is a simple, raw style that focuses on function over looks. It uses plain layouts, bold text, and minimal styling, creating a rough, unpolished, and highly functional user experience.

Looking to infuse your designs with a raw and unconventional aesthetic? Look no further than our curated selection of Brutalist Fonts.

Inspired by the architectural movement that shares its name, these fonts are designed to make a bold and striking impact.

With their distinct characteristics and rugged charm, Brutalist fonts bring a unique personality to any design project.

From websites to posters, logos to social media graphics, these fonts will captivate your audience and leave a lasting impression.

Join us as we explore the best Brutalist fonts, handpicked to help you create designs that break the mold and make a statement.

Get ready to embrace the power of Brutalism and elevate your designs to new heights of edginess!

10 Best Brutalist Fonts – Overview

BEST BRUTALIST FONTS – UNLIMITED DOWNLOADS: 50 Million+ Fonts & Design Assets

Download all the Brutalist Fonts you need and many other design elements, available for a monthly subscription by subscribing to Envato Elements. The subscription costs $16.50 per month and gives you unlimited access to a massive and growing library of over 50 million items that can be downloaded as often as you need (stock effect & element packs too)!

30+ Best Brutalist Fonts

1. Wolker

When we talk about our first font, Wolker, we want to highlight its modern and essential characteristics. As a versatile font, it excels in large and medium sizes, bringing forth a stunning and commanding presence.

With Wolker, we have the ability to layer two font styles, resulting in extraordinary headers that catch the eye. This font is the perfect choice for designs that embrace the theme of brutalism, adding a touch of raw power and edginess.

Wolker’s characters are exceptionally well-suited for a wide range of applications. From editorial design to branding, advertising, T-shirt design, publicity, and digital media, Wolker delivers outstanding results.

2. Nimbus Sans

We are excited to introduce the latest versions of the Nimbus font family from URW Type Foundry.

Nimbus Sans Font is a comprehensive collection of fonts that offers a variety of styles and weights to suit different design needs. With its extensive range of options, this font family provides ample versatility for any project. Whether you’re working on print or digital media, Nimbus Sans Font has got you covered.

3. Monument Extended

Our next font in line is Monument Extended, a truly powerful and versatile typeface that exudes quality. This extended font is designed to make a statement, whether you’re creating bold editorial designs, graphic-heavy prints, or even a simple yet impactful logo.

Its distinctive and eye-catching appearance guarantees that your designs will stand out and leave a lasting impression of uniqueness.

Monument Extended is a testament to the art of typography, meticulously crafted to ensure exceptional visual impact. Its extended letterforms provide ample space for creativity, allowing you to experiment and create visually striking compositions.

The best part is that Pangram let you try this Neo Monument font for free, for non-commercial purposes.

4. Molend

Looking for neubrutalism fonts? We are thrilled to introduce the Molend Font, designed by Ahmad Ramzi Fahruddin and published by Arterfak Project. This exceptional font family offers a unique and captivating style that is sure to elevate your designs.

The Molend Brutalism Font Family consists of one exquisite style that showcases the talent and creativity of its designer. With its carefully crafted letterforms, Molend brings a touch of futuristic elegance and sophistication to any project.

5. Ella

Ella, a stunning typeface that seamlessly blends classic calligraphy with contemporary digital design. The creation of Ella began as a morphological design study by Laura Mesegeur, who embarked on a journey to explore how traditional calligraphy models could be adapted and transformed into modern stencil typefaces.

One defining characteristic of stencil type is the presence of negative space between each part of every letter, allowing for precise cutting into materials without the counters falling out.

As designers who have had the pleasure of using the Planta Font Family, we can confidently say that it is a true masterpiece. Designed by Santi Rey and published by Monotype, Planta offers a delightful range of possibilities with its four unique styles and family package options.

Planta is a font that effortlessly balances elegance and versatility. Its meticulously crafted letterforms exude a sense of refined sophistication, making it suitable for a wide array of design projects.

Embark on a typographic adventure with DIN 2014, a font that fuses the essence of a cherished classic with a contemporary twist. This captivating typeface pays homage to the renowned DIN typeface while breathing new life into its design.

Since its release by Paratype, DIN 2014 has become a go-to choice for designers and typographers seeking a harmonious balance between tradition and innovation.

You can also find a free DIN look-a-like on Google Fonts, called Barlow, which is our pick for one of the best neo brutalist fonts on Google Fonts.

Frequently Asked Questions

What is neo brutalism design?

Neo-Brutalism design is a modern take on Brutalist architecture, emphasizing raw, minimal aesthetics. It incorporates geometric shapes, bold colors, and a functional approach, creating a striking, unconventional style often used in UI design, web layouts, and contemporary branding.

What is a brutalist design?

Brutalist design comes from the French term béton brut, meaning raw concrete. It emerged in the late 1940s and early 1950s, emphasizing exposed materials, minimal ornamentation, and a bold, utilitarian aesthetic focused on structure and functionality over decoration.

What is the brutalist font?

A brutalist font embraces the raw, unpolished aesthetic of brutalist design. These fonts often feature bold, heavy letterforms, sharp edges, and unconventional structures, reflecting the stark, functional nature of brutalism with non-traditional layouts and striking visual impact.

What does Brutalism symbolize?

Brutalism symbolizes resilience, functionality, and honesty in design. It represents creation from raw, unadorned materials, emphasizing structure over ornamentation. Rooted in post-war reconstruction, it stands as a bold statement of strength, simplicity, and purpose in both architecture and visual design.

What is brutalist web design?

Brutalist web design is a simple, raw style that focuses on function over looks. It uses plain layouts, bold text, and minimal styling, creating a rough, unpolished, and highly functional user experience.
